profile_positions.description:
• Finance Manager & lead for large Biofuels investment projects for the DACH and Benelux regions (e.g. BioLNG plant at Energy and Chemicals Park Rheinland), ensuring integrated value chain economics evaluation in a highly complex and uncertain environment. Delivering the full range of finance support (CFO of the deal) including tax, treasury, accounting, structuring, and setting up and operationalizing the new business model and financial systems across the value chain.

• Managing the Finance team for the E2E channel & product value optimization across the Downstream Biofuels & Hydrocarbon Supply Chain of the Integrated Performance Unit (IPU) in Germany, Austria and Switzerland (DACH). T&S DACH (one of the 6 biggest IPUs in Shell's portfolio) runs a world-class Global commodity trading business, balancing supply and demand of biofuels & hydrocarbons by optimizing the outflow of the refinery, trading volumes and 3rd party purchases into the most valuable outlet whilst delivering a competitive supply chain to the marketing Business (Retail or Commercial Fuels): Cash contribution (before OH) $1.4b, NIBIAT >$600m, T&S costs >$300m, 3 refineries, 55 depots, 2000+ Retail sites, 10 import/export countries, volume 23mT.

• Managing the Price Risk Exposure (team) - paper & physical - and the underlying processes (incl. hedging techniques and related accounting, hedging systems), ensuring the hedge position is correct and the P&L drivers are fully understood;

• Finance Lead on M&A projects

• Finance Lead for developing the 2025+ strategy for the DACH portfolio (assets, products, supply chain, commercial outlets) in line with the energy transition

volunteer_experiences.description: The Future Energy Lions network aims to help shape and accelerate the Energy Transition and discussion within Shell and ensure knowledge sharing and project capability building (e.g. Solar Moerdijk) on this topic. The network has >1200 members globally with hubs in NL, UK, USA, Brunei, India & Nigeria
